alert.note: Alert for Alleghany; Ashe (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 12:04PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: .An area of rain showers, with pockets of moderate to heavy rainfall, will track southeast from Grayson county VA into Alleghany County NC during the next 1 to 2 hours. Much of Alleghany County NC has seen rainfall of 2-4 inches in the past couple of days. The ground is saturated and additional rainfall of 1 to 2 inches will quickly result in excessive runoff and cause minor flooding. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...In northwest North Carolina, Alleghany NC. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1201 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Brush Creek, Elk Creek, Grassy Creek, Elkin Creek, East Prong Roaring River, Gully Creek, Crab Fork, Glade Creek, Basin Creek, Big Pine Creek, Cove Creek and Little River. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sparta... Ennice... Whitehead... Twin Oaks... Glade Valley... Stratford... Scottville... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
